title: Tottenham planning Christian Eriksen sale in January to prevent Dane from leaving for free next summer
text:

Spurs hope to sell Christian Eriksen to Real Madrid in January to prevent him leaving for free next summer.

The Spanish giants are poised to firm up their interest in the Denmark midfielder after he admitted he was keen to join them at the back end of last season.

At the time Spurs wanted around £100million for a player who has matured into one of their key figures since his arrival in 2013 for a bargain £11.5million.

That figure was widely seen as unrealistic, however, and Real prioritised the capture of Eden Hazard from Chelsea .

Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba has been another one of Zinedine Zidane’s targets but, with the France superstar negotiating a new deal with his Premier League club, Real are considering other options.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Speaking in the summer, Eriksen declared he wanted to ‘try something new’ after six years in north London.

Describing Real Madrid as ‘a step up’ he urged them to ‘pick up the phone’ if they were interested, but Los Blancos decided against the move.

With Eriksen adamant that he does not want to accept any of the substantial contract offers made to him by Spurs, the club have decided to try to get him off the books in January.

Eriksen insisted earlier this week that his commitment to the club has not been affected by his contractual situation.

(Image: Getty Images)

He said: “Everyone is professional and in all clubs there is talk of players going away.

“That side of the matter has no bearing on how we have performed so far this season.”

But he has contributed just one goal and one assist so far this season.
description: Spurs hope to offload the midfielder with Real Madrid the favourites to secure his signature
